Detailed Description

Object for controlling the DAZ Studio background progress indicator.

DzBackgroundProgress provides a thread-safe interface for using the DAZ Studio Application background progress dialog. Simply create an instance to start displaying progress, when you call finish() or the DzBackgroundProgress instance is destroyed, it will stop displaying progress. Multiple DzBackgroundProgress instances may be active at the same time. As long as one DzBackgroundProgress instance is active, the background progress indicator will be shown to the user.

The DAZ Studio background progress indicator is an integrated part of the application status bar which is intended for displaying the progress of operations occurring in a background thread. Unlike the application progress dialog, the background progress indicator is not blocking - allowing the user to continue to interact with and use the application normally while an operation is being performed in the background.

Example:
    void MyClass::doSomething() 
    {
    // Create a DzBackgroundProgress object, and start a progress operation.
    DzBackgroundProgress    myProgress( "Doing Something...", 100 );

    for( int i = 0; i < 100; i++ ){
        ...do something...
        // Step progress
        myProgress.step();
    }

    // Tell the progress bar you are finished.
    // This call is only needed if you want to finish the progress before leaving scope
    myProgress.finish();
    }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzBackgroundProgress::DzBackgroundProgress ( const QString &  info,
int  totalSteps,
bool  isCancellable = false 
)

Constructs a DzBackgroundProgress and begins a progress operation, showing the progress indicator if it is not already visible. It is safe to construct DzBackgroundProgress from non-GUI threads.

Parameters:
info The message that is displayed in the progress dialog.
totalSteps The total number of steps for the progress operation. Pass in -1 to create an indeterminate progress indicator which will continue rolling until finish() is called.
isCancellable If true, the 'Cancel' button will be displayed on the progress dialog.
DzBackgroundProgress::~DzBackgroundProgress (  )  [virtual]

Destructor - ends the progress operation if finish() has not already been called.

Member Function Documentation

void DzBackgroundProgress::cancel (  )  [virtual]

Cancels the current operation. If the current operation can not be cancelled, this has no effect. This function is Thread-Safe.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzBackgroundProgress::finish (  )  [virtual]

Ends the current progress operation, if no other progress operations are active, the progress indicator is automatically hidden. It is not necessary to explicitly call this function - the progress operation will be ended when the DzBackgroundProgress instance is destroyed. However, it may sometimes be desirable to end a progress operation before the instance is destroyed, so this function is provided for those cases.

Note:
This function is re-entrant, but not thread-safe. It should be called from the same thread that created the operation.

Implements IDzProgress.

bool DzBackgroundProgress::isActive (  )  [static]

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if there is an active progress operation, false if no progress operations are currently active.
bool DzBackgroundProgress::isCancelled (  )  const [virtual]

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress operation has been cancelled, otherwise false. If the progress operation can not be cancelled, this will always be false.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzBackgroundProgress::setInfo ( const QString &  info  )  [virtual]

Sets the message displayed for this progress operation. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
info The message to display on the progress dialog.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzBackgroundProgress::step ( int  numSteps = 1  )  [virtual]

Steps the progress indicator. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
numSteps The number of steps to move the progress indicator.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzBackgroundProgress::update ( int  position  )  [virtual]

Updates the progress indicator to the given number of steps. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
position The number of steps to set the progress indicator position to.

Implements IDzProgress.
